snippet: The company, which had been in talks with the Cuomo administration in recent weeks, said it was losing too much money operating the James A. FitzPatrick plant in Oswego County.
abstract: Entergy Corporation says it will shutdown 40-year-old James A FitzPatrick Nuclear Power Plant in Oswego County, NY, drawing criticism from Gov Andrew Cuomo, who has expressed concern over fate of plant's workers; Entergy says plant has become too costly to maintain; company is fighting to continue running Indian Point plant in Westchester, which state has sought to shut down.
lead_paragraph: The company, which had been in talks with the Cuomo administration in recent weeks, said it was losing too much money operating the James A. FitzPatrick plant in Oswego County.

headline.main: Entergy to Close Nuclear Plant on Lake Ontario, Angering Cuomo
headline.print_headline: Indian Point Owner to Close Nuclear Plant Upstate, Angering Governor
